186033356.review: Final fantasy X /X-2 est vraiment super. Belles musiques, belle histoire. Mais n'achetez pas le jeu sur ordinateur car la version steam bug beaucoup. Deux bugs me sont arrivés. Le premier est que le jeu se ferme sans raison, ni code d'erreur et à n'importe quel moment. Le deuxième, un problème de sauvegarde. J'ai sauvegardé à plusieurs points de sauvegardes en une 1 heure et le jeu à crache, j'ai relancé et le jeu n'avais pas pris en compte toutes les saves faites en 1 heure. Je n'ai pas pu finir le jeu à cause de ses bugs qui ont fini par me gâcher mon plaisir. Je trouve cela honteux de vendre un jeu à ce prix là avec ce genre de problèmes !

185894473.review: Do not purchase this product. It crashes constantly, there are consistent and as of yet fixed issues with almost all in game cutscenes that cause them to splat to flat green. There is truly no reason to purchase this. I cannot stress enough, the existence of this horrendous port, is why emulation must be protected.

185889417.review: A história mais marcante do mundo dos games. Sem duvida lembrarei disto para toda minha vida. Eventualmente no decorrer da jogatina você sentirá felicidade genuína, tristeza, conforto. O final mais emocionante de todos, mais tocante. É lindíssimo, belíssimo. A trilha sonora 10/10. História 11/10. Entretanto o jogo tem seus lados ruins. Demora muito para achar um local de save, existem momentos que você fica 2 horas jogando sem salvar. É muito fácil morrer neste jogo. Mecânicas complexas de mais, exige grinding demais, punitivo demais, sensação de progressão é ruim. Combates repetitivos. Lutas com chefes são geralmente injustas. Tem 15 minutos de cutscene, se você morrer na luta com o chefe o que geralmente acontece muito, você terá de ver novamente as cutscene já que não há como pula-las. Não tem como zerar este jogo sem estudar. Você precisa ter boa noção de matématica. Você precisa saber o que fazem TODAS as habilidades, especiais, magias negras e brancas. Precisa saber buildar, precisa de armas e escudos fortes para isso é nescessário muito muito explorar o mundo. Os puzzles são desafiadores, leva-se muito tempo para resolver apenas um!  Nivel de dedicação para zerar este jogo é enorme. Clts fiquem longem!!! Com certeza é o jogo mais dificil que já joguei. Bastante frustante e estressante. Levando em conta todas essas coisas ruins o jogo vale a pena! Vale a pena porque a história é pura arte, não se acha tal coisa em outro lugar. Jogo estará para sempre em meu coração.

185825819.review:
Final Fantasy X is an excellent choice for RPG fans. It offers a captivating story with memorable characters, although the repetition of enemies can make the gameplay feel a bit monotonous at times. Achieving all the achievements is quite a grind, bordering on exhausting, but the overall experience makes it worthwhile.

Final Fantasy X-2, on the other hand, improves on the battle system, adding more flexibility and variety compared to its predecessor. However, its story lacks the emotional impact of the first game, making it less engaging. Completing the game 100% without a guide is nearly impossible, and going for the platinum trophy is a test of patience.

Overall, this remaster is a great package for fans of classic RPGs, but be prepared for a time-consuming journey if you're aiming for full completion.

185811470.review:
FFX: chiquita aguantada de llorera al final. Tiene combates variados y el sistema de esferas es interesante. El elenco no es mi favorito ni la historia es la que más me hace clic, pero los momentos bonitos son muy bonitos. Esta es mi historia.

FFX-2: duré 10 minutos y no sabía qué estaba ocurriendo. Volveré algún día.

185554831.review:
Final Fantasy X is, without a doubt, my favorite entry in the legendary Final Fantasy series, and this HD remaster does a stellar job of breathing new life into an already timeless classic! 
With updated visuals, refined audio, and a bundled sequel, this package is a treasure trove for fans and newcomers alike.
The heart and soul of Final Fantasy X lies in its story and characters. 
Tidus and Yuna, the protagonists, are the emotional core of the narrative. 
Their journey is one of love, sacrifice, and hope, themes that are beautifully interwoven with the game’s rich lore and world-building. 
Spira, the world they inhabit, feels alive, vibrant, and steeped in culture, making every location memorable, from the serene Besaid Island to the haunting Zanarkand ruins.
The combat system, built around the Conditional Turn-Based Battle (CTB) mechanics, is intuitive yet deeply strategic, allowing players to plan their moves with precision. 
The Sphere Grid, used for character progression, adds a satisfying layer of customization and growth, ensuring every battle feels meaningful. 
For returning players, the inclusion of the Expert Sphere Grid in the remaster is a welcome challenge.
Visually, the remaster elevates the game to modern standards with enhanced character models, improved textures, and vibrant lighting effects. 
The re-orchestrated soundtrack adds a fresh yet familiar tone to the experience, though purists will be pleased to find the option to switch back to the original score.
Final Fantasy X-2, on the other hand, feels like a step down from its predecessor... 
While it offers a lighter and more adventurous tone, its narrative lacks the depth and emotional resonance of Final Fantasy X. 
The Dressphere system, though unique, can feel gimmicky and fails to capture the strategic brilliance of the Sphere Grid. 
However, the game's 'perfect' ending, where Tidus reunites with Yuna, is a standout moment that alone makes the sequel worth playing. 
It provides a sense of closure and satisfaction that fans of their love story will truly appreciate!
That said, Final Fantasy X remains the highlight of the package. 
Tidus and Yuna’s relationship is heartfelt and central to the game’s emotional impact, making their moments together, from the iconic laughter scene to the unforgettable ending, resonate deeply. 
Their bond is a testament to the game’s exceptional storytelling.
For those who missed these games the first time around, this remaster is the perfect opportunity to experience two beloved titles. 
For longtime fans like me, it’s a chance to relive cherished memories in a more polished and immersive way. 
Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster is a must-play collection that stands as a testament to why Final Fantasy has endured as one of gaming’s greatest franchises.

185271452.review: Although I would recommend this game to anyone and everyone, it has 1 annoying glitch I have come across where the screen goes green during CG cutscenes, oddly it doesn't always do it, and as of this review I haven't found a solution that works. Despite that annoying glitch, this game is amazing now as it was back in 2002 when it was first released on PS2, obviously the graphics have had an upgrade for this, and I love the orchestral soundtrack rather than the original, though both are amazing in my opinion, the story is very enjoyable with some slightly cringe worthy dialogue now and then, but looking past that this game has aged astoundingly well and I highly recommend playing it.

185242557.review:
I played Final Fantasy X when it first came out, and it’s been a personal favourite ever since. The level of nostalgia I feel when diving back into this game is hard to put into words. It takes me straight back to those school days, chatting with mates about theories, crafting new strategies, and just being absolutely obsessed with the world of Spira.

Revisiting it through the HD Remaster has been such a rewarding experience. Playing through again, this time pushing for 100% completion, felt like reconnecting with an old friend. Spending time with these characters and immersing myself in Spira’s world was even more fulfilling than I expected. There’s a certain magic in its story and setting that just pulls you in.

If you’re thinking about picking this up, I’d absolutely recommend it. Take your time with the story; it’s worth savouring. Sure, the English dub can be a bit rough around the edges, and some of the character designs—especially for the women—can feel a little over-the-top. But if you can look past those quirks, the gameplay and narrative make the journey well worth it.

Whether you’re returning to Spira or experiencing it for the first time, Final Fantasy X HD Remaster is a timeless classic that’s still got that X-factor.

185237601.review: 剧情超级赞，别的也没什么。

185235593.review:
This game is an absolute masterpiece.  The combat system is the best of every Final Fantasy game I've played (1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 10).  The story is, in my opinion, profound.  As someone who has played over 30,000 hours of video games in my life, I cannot recommend this game highly enough.

10/10.

Quise rejugarlo en esta versión  "HD" y la verdad este port de pc da pena, gráficamente ni fu ni fa pero eso no es tan importante, tampoco que vaya a 30 fps lo que si podrían haber metido un acelerador de velocidad de combate sobre todo para que no sea tan pesado tantos combates random a cada paso, las cinemáticas tienen problemas y no se ven por momentos jaja de chiste y sin contar los crasheos sin motivo que te puede dar en cualquier momento y que el juego se cierre y bueno a volver a donde lo guardaste, la verdad intente jugarlo igual pero se me hizo imposible, este port esta casi a la altura del port basura del final fantasy xiii no le gana por poco en lo malo que es. 
Es un gran final fantasy pero no recomiendo esta versión para nada.

首次通关毕业撒花！ 
游戏性，放在现在，可能不是所有人都能接受的。刷盘很肝.... 不过游戏内有官方内置的修改器，玩起来会轻松很多，有4倍速，每回合回满状态，提升或降低遇敌概率，满道具，幻光球都是99..
而且网上有大把攻略。  当然，这个游戏需要投入大量时间精力付出，也值得投入大量时间精力去付出。
剧情  FFX的魅力所在， 大悲剧中套小悲剧，众多小悲剧融合成一幕大悲剧。虽然 玩游戏前剧情已经看过起码四五遍了，回回都能那啥眼里进沙子 。（是啊，即使知道结局是这样。）但是剧情结尾从to zanarkand响起到素敌这首歌的结束，每一分钟都是泪点，哎还是蚌埠住啊。
总 -【超越时光的经典】 
--
说说缺点  CG绿屏12次（可以上网看完整的cg演出），闪退3次（没办法 ） 不过 这些都是小小小小问题，不值一提!

wer nach der Story (oder eben vor Abschluss des finalen Bosses) noch nicht genug hat, kann hier (wie ich ...) hunderte Stunden investieren

Für mich eines der besten Spiele aller Zeiten!

184869464.review: Nostalgia. The world building and story is so amazing. 10/10

184866562.review:
Final Fantasy X (FFX) has a great, unique fantasy world in a Caribbean-like setting called Spira. The lore is great. 
After the initial action sequence, the story takes some time to get going. The game is linear, which suits a pilgrimage story where you travel with a group of characters from town to town. The characters are easy to recognise, but most of them, with the exception of the two protagonists, are rather one-dimensional. Their journey is accompanied by a spiritual atmosphere, supported by excellent music, interesting locations, and memorable cutscenes. Unfortunately, the cutscenes cannot be skipped, which can be annoying when you have to replay a battle and watch them all over again. As for the music, Final Fantasy X has two of my favourite piano songs, with "To Zanarkand" being one of the best pieces of music in the series. 
This is the first Final Fantasy to use a 3D engine, and although it now looks dated, especially in terms of facial expressions and animations, it still manages to capture the unique atmosphere and tone of its world Spira. Unfortunately, the game can suffer from occasional crashes on modern PCs running at high resolutions, as memory settings were restricted at the time.
The difficulty is manageable up to a point towards the end of the game, where it suddenly spikes and becomes extremely difficult - unfortunately you have to grind random encounters to level up.I like the ATB combat system in FFX because you can always swap characters during combat, which makes combat quite dynamic, and you can swap out characters with low health or swap in characters to exploit a particular enemy weakness. However, as with previous games, combat can get a bit repetitive and tiresome after a while. The character upgrade system allows for customisation, but it could have been better presented visually as it does not provide a good overview. 
Aside from combat, there is a major mini-game called Blitzball, a football-like underwater game with team management, which is quite fun but also optional.
What I dislike are the random encounters and the puzzles in the temples: the type of puzzle is always the same, but gets more and more complex. You solve them by trial and error, which is fine for the first temples, but less fun for the later ones. Another point of criticism is the English translation and voice acting, which could have been better. Another small negative is that the characters' reactions are sometimes not plausible (they do not ask questions or remain simply silent).
Overall, FFX is a great game, because of the story it tells and the atmosphere it creates.

---

Final Fantasy X/2 (FFX/2) is a direct sequel that has a very different, light-hearted, not-too-serious tone, similar to Charlie's Angles, where you go on various missions with a group of three girls. I think it's fun, but some fans may have wanted a more consistent and serious sequel to FFX. The party consists of Yuna and Rikku, as well as Paine - the new girl. Unfortunately, Paine's characterisation remains flat throughout the game.
Story-wise, I like that FFX/2 deals with the question of what the heroes do after the great adventure (of FFX) is over. How does life go on? The story in FFX/2 is not as strong as in FFX, but I think it's fitting. However, the game designers couldn't seem to agree on an ending: the endings in FFX/2 are watered down, and earlier events are completely undone by later additions, which I think is a big narrative mistake. One of the additions is the final mission, which I like because it deals with conflicts between the main trio and fleshes out their characters. I wish moments like this were already in the main game of FFX/2. For me, the default "sad" ending is the true ending. There is also a "perfect" ending if you complete the game at 100%, but this is almost impossible to achieve without external guides and is extremely time consuming.
FFX/2 uses most of the same assets as FFX, which is a shame as there are hardly any new locations. At least there are no more puzzle temples from FFX. 
The combat system is new, based on a "job" system, here called dress. You can no longer switch characters during a fight, but you can change dresses, which allows you to react to different enemies. I like how the combatants automatically move and change positions during combat, giving the impression of a dynamic battle. The difficulty of FFX/2 also rises sharply towards the end of the game, so grinding will be necessary.

184860092.review: es muy buen juego como para traer recuerdos de cuando jugabas a la play 2, merecido jugarlo

184858970.review:
This is just a review for Final Fantasy X, not X-2, as I've never managed to get into the extremely tonally different sequel enough to play it for more than a couple hours:

A contender for my all time favourite game. I first played it as a kid, but I've played it many times since - so I know it isn't just nostalgia I'm feeling. In terms of fantasy settings, it's unmatched - the story, the world and the characters are all fantastic. The voice acting is spot-on - don't take the laughing memes too seriously - that scene is touching when you see it in context. The sphere grid levelling system is so good, that I'm bewildered as to why it hasn't since been built upon or replicated by at least Square Enix. Like the game itself, this system is linear at first, but then opens up later on and is complex enough to be engaging without being a nuisance. Music - it's stellar. Art design - that too. Honestly, the only thing I could even point out as being less that excellent are a few specific side quests that felt a bit clunky.

If you've got experience of other Final Fantasy's but never found them all that special, don't let that put you off this one, it easily out-shines the rest of the series (yes, I think it's better than 7, by far).

Aside from the high praises I give the game itself, the port could have been better. I have had an issue playing this on Steam Deck, specifically it'd immediately crash on cut-scenes, which when considering the game can't be loaded into without a cut-scene beginning (you can skip it), it's not great. There are ways to get around this though, but this isn't a troubleshooting post, so I'll leave you to search for that. On PC though, I've not had any problems.

A trilha sonora arrebatadora composta por Nobuo Uematsu complementa essa obra-prima que continuará ecoando no coração dos fãs por muitos anos. Te amo FFX!

X的故事让我觉得最终幻想作为标题是如此合适，整个故事就是一场梦一般的幻想。单论X的话并不是一个HE故事，但是让我感觉没有任何遗憾。正是这样一个结尾才让人回味无穷。
整个流程下来最让人不满意的就是动不动崩溃，甚至有过场动画直接绿屏的问题。这是SE的问题，移植做的一坨屎。然后就是一些现在来看有些过时的设计。比如说暗雷，不过还好HD版可以直接调整。

如果哪一天X-3有消息的话，应该会把X-2和2.5的内容体验一遍。现在的话X的结尾对我来说已是最好。

本作主角提达的声优和动捕都是森田成一，并且这是森田成一的声优出道作品。一开始他只是担任动捕，但是机缘巧合下也担任了提达的声优。以上的小故事出自武内骏辅主持的「おねだり！声優フェス」2023年10月的切片。值得一提的是他居然还记得提达的战斗姿势，还做了现场演示，让人会心一笑。但是也因为这是声优出道作品，一开始让人感觉有点棒读。反倒是现在他配的提达感觉没那味了。

184258457.review:
Final Fantasy X is an absolute masterpiece and needs no further recommendation or acknowledgement. X-2, however, is in a slightly more precarious position. I played it back when it originally came out, and I completed it 100%. This is a game I had very good memories of, and was actually really excited to get back into... My overall impression of it now, as I try to claw my way through its campaign, is not as positive as I'd like.

Some of it is still great: I still think the battle system is really nice, and I like the class-changing mechanic. I vaguely remember this game being lambasted for being "too girly", with the "dresspheres" lending some sort of a "magical girl" vibe to the game that many didn't appreciate. I, for one, really liked it, and still think it gives the game a very unique and pleasant atmosphere. The facial animations are also a clear step up from its predecessor. That's... about all the good that I can say about it.
The story is absolutely painful to get through. I did not remember Brother being so annoying and so present in the game. Any scene involving Yuna in almost any way feels awkward. No one in the entire world (aside from Maechen) seems to treat her with the respect and reverence that she is due. I understand the attempt to make things more lighthearted, but it feels super stilted and forced. The mission structure is cool, but it's also very punishing if you want to engage with the game without assistance, as you will get a shit ending and have to redo the whole thing. There is a very neat NG+ mechanic, but that does not excuse the busy work involved.

Another thing worth highlighting is in regards to versions: 
The ones packed here are the "International" versions of both games. This means they have extra stuff, bits that weren't part of the original release. I find these releases to pretty much always be misses... The stuff added is always just padding. You can ignore most of it pretty safely, but if you are keen on 100%-ing stuff, the runtime of these games has been MASSIVELY inflated with the addition of the Dark Aeon stuff on X and the creature capture mechanic in X-2. And none of it is super interesting. Although, if you are curious and analytical, you might get a kick at how the monster mechanics in X-2 might have informed XIII-2's design.

When it's all said and done, I'm happy I got to revisit these games, but I don't think I'd replay these versions ever. I'd sooner bust out the PS2 and play the original release of X. As for X-2... OOF. That one I'm probably leaving alone for a long time... Which saddens me, in a way. I wish I could have stayed with my memories of it being a great game instead of being proven otherwise. Ignorance sometimes really is bliss.

184108082.review:
Jogo Horrível!
Quando eu era criança, tinha acabado de jogar Final Fantasy XII, fiz absolutamente tudo que era possível no jogo e zerei de todas as formas, de tão bom que ele é. Isso me deixou curioso para conhecer outros Final Fantasies. Experimentei Tactics, VII e III, todos ótimos jogos.

Então, decidi jogar Final Fantasy X... e simplesmente não gostei. A gameplay, na minha opinião, simplesmente não existe. Isso foi minha impressão ainda quando criança.

Agora, mais de 20 anos depois, resolvi dar uma nova chance. Vi algumas análises elogiando o jogo e, como ele estava na promoção por R$20, decidi arriscar. Sinceramente? De graça já seria caro! Minha reação foi exatamente a mesma de antes, mas agora, mais velho, consigo entender melhor por que acho o jogo tão ruim.
Final Fantasy X foca tanto na história nas primeiras 2-3 horas que você não sente nenhuma motivação para explorar a gameplay. Durante esse tempo, o jogo praticamente não te deixa experimentar os elementos clássicos de RPG: nada de equipamentos, magias, runas, combos, farm ou qualquer outra coisa que realmente me cativaria como jogador.

Eu tenho uma regra muito simples para qualquer jogo: se a gameplay não é divertida, não vale a pena investir na história. Afinal, isso é um JOGO, não um filme. 

Se você é amante de RPG, nem jogue isso, porque provavelmente irá odiar. É só perda de tempo. Agora, se você gosta de ver uma história bem contada e não liga para os aspectos de RPG no geral, Final Fantasy X pode ser para você!
Eu tentei várias vezes, mas não dá. Essa é minha análise, se você diz que gosta de Final Fantasy X pela gameplay, me desculpe, mas você não faz a minima ideia do que é um RPG de verdade!

184071656.review: When you go online, people glaze this game to no end. There's the occasional "game bad, but I like other FF entry" and it's bombed.... Looking at these games for their mechanics and progress for the franchise, it did it's job. Otherwise, it's incredibly difficult to get into. Perhaps in my getting older I don't appreciate certain elements of story telling opting for media that appreciates my time and intelligence. A 10000% willing to immerse myself and accept realities of the fictional world to better enjoy the narrative....but feels like a fanfiction compared to others in a negative sense. [spoiler]We glorify Titus, spend a game with him and chasing him down in another. Imagine falling in love with essentially the idea of something…or manifestation of some dudes regrets…..? In my head Titus was an idiot, so she ends her story being embraced by an imaginary buffoon and continues doing what? Never be used? Well, all she proved is that Titus is all she lived for. Ask me, that’s the saddest ending. Frankly a big waste of time

183980783.review:
После 9 части такого я точно не ожидал. Игра пусть и выглядит куда более технологично, но проигрывает почти во всём прошлой части. 
 Сюжет всратый. Диалоги бездушные. Персонажи имеют задаток и харизму, но предыдущие минусы и малое кол-во диалогов мешают им нормально развиваться. Я вообще в афиге оказался, когда на 34-36 часах прохождения залез в гайд и понял, что я уже приближаюсь к финалу (игру я дропнул кстати), потому что за столько времени мне вообще не смогли нормально раскрыть персонажей.
 Геймплей пусть и пытается в инновации, с течением времени становится очень тягомотным из-за прокачки и кол-ва гринда на боссов (в частности 4х блять босс файтов с Сеймуром). Особенно мешает неприличная частота появления врагов на экране. Между локациями вам дается несколько длинных коридоров, где каждые 3-5 секунд спавнятся враги, которые очень быстро начинают бесить. 
 Прокачка это вообще отдельная песня. Тут вам дается как бы поле со сферами, где каждая отвечает за свой бафф, и персонаж должен двигаться по своей определенной ветке, чтобы нормально прокачатся. Из-за того, что я просто двигался как мне по кайфу, у меня получился недокачанный Тидус, который нормально не вносил урона, да и в общем был балластом для всей пати уже ближе к Сеймуру Натусу. Кимари абсолютно бесполезен, вот серьезно, у него нет никаких стоящих особенностей. Если Вакка может с легкостью расправляться с летающими врагами, Аурон с бронированными, Тидус с ловкими, Лулу с элементалями, то Кимари просто бесполезен. У него есть всякие прикольные абилки, которые на подобии Квины из ФФ9 позволяет поглощать ульты, но даже это не то чтобы сильно помогает.
 И как и в прошлой части, не имеют никакого смысла статусные эффекты от ваших атак, потому что их попросту негде применять. Обычные файты вы быстро выигрываете, а у боссов почти ко всему резист, а к чему нет резиста, просто не имеет смысла кастовать. К примеру бой с Сеймур Флюксом, из всего я смог на него кастануть только сайленс, но от него толка нет, потому что он очень редко кастует магию.
 Я разве что могу похвалить музыку, но тут заслуга уже опытных в серии композиторов, хотя иногда попадаются локации, где играет не пойми что.
 Я не могу порекомендовать эту игру. У меня просто закончилось терпение из-за всего кала. который на тебя сбрасывает эта игра. 9 часть на голову лучше этой игры. 6/10

183882671.review:
This is only for FFX, I did not play X-2 that is also contained in the package.

The good: 
Characters and story. It may not be as ground-shaking as it was when originally released 20 years ago, but the main cast is still very likable with their interesting backstories, and the main plot line has a few interesting twists. The game still holds up mechanically, with fights being interesting, unique sphere grid leveling system and some pretty cool bosses. Moment to moment gameplay is still enjoyable after all these years.

The bad:
I'll pass over graphics, because everyone can see how the game looks like, and while it is not ugly, it definitely is old, even with new HD textures. My main issue with the game was amount of grind it excepts from the player, bosses that will just one-hit your whole party if you didn't grind enough levels, and side content hidden behind even more grind that is just ridiculous if you are aiming for 100% completion. I guess it's just old PS2 jRPG design school.

Overall - I think is a good game still worth playing, especially if you can grab it on a sale for pennies. Just get UnX mod that will help with some annoying bits of the old engine, like not being able to skip cutscenes, which without the mod can be very annoying if you retry the same boss 5th time and need to watch it's 5 minutes monologue

[b] Kimahri is cool [/b], and that's the first thing I want to say ... I don't understand what his problem is, if you follow Wakka's path... 
The game is also amazing, although the port is bad... 8/10 ... 

Pros:
+ The plot moves along very quickly and the main characters quickly come together as a team... All of them are quite interesting and appealing ... 
+ I never liked  the pair of Tidus and Yuna because I disliked Zidane from FF IX and especially hated their love line with Garnet (I'm sick of impudent people and womanisers and especially when they get decent, good girls afterwards) ... But Tidus is different, he was a cheerful guy, somewhat simple, but not impudent, and his sympathy for Yuna was natural ... In the end, I changed my mind and this is a sign of a good character presentation... And I have mixed feelings about the final ... 
+ The progressing system is interesting, although at first it is difficult if you manage it yourself... But thanks to this, each of my team members was useful ... 
+ The music is as beautiful as ever... Guadosalam and Via Purifico are something incredible ... 

Cons
- Oh, damn, I hate [spoiler] the pairing of Lula and Wakka! This is the worst couple ever and of all the FF couples I've ever played ! Nothing led to this at all ... This is where the real fantasy is, not all this magic and technology...  [/spoiler] 
- The plot feels a bit fragmented... In FF VII and IX, I have not observed this ... 
- A very linear level structure and it really is almost always lines ... 
- The trials in the temples would have been okay, if not for these stupid, long animations... And I would have taken points off the final score for the Bevelle Temple ... O, hell ...

183757744.review:
10/10

If you're new to JRPGs and looking for somewhere to start, start with FFX. The characters are great, the story is captivating and the world of Spira feels like a dream to explore. The remaster does its best to elevate some of the original graphics without compromising any of the PS2 era charm, something the game has in abundance. I definitely recommend, especially if you're looking for something to sink 20-30 hours into.

183756984.review:
Incredibly bad game story telling. I'm sure it has a bunch of fan boys but the starting narrative is overwhelmingly uninteresting. It starts with like 15 minutes of cutscenes..

You're a soccer player of some kind.. then an attack happens.. then your friend disappears.. your dad shows up... suddenly you're in the water.

There's no meaning to any of it. It's just random things happening. You start to fight water monsters but that doesn't matter because a boss eats them. You start to fight the boss but THAT doesn't matter because he runs off.

I have no idea how people cannot see how dull this all is. Not only do you have no agency in your choices, but the story has no meaning because there's no context or reason for anything happening. It's just.. A happens. then B happens. then C happens.

Why? Because it does.

I just realized this 1minute cutscene is going to replay every time I start the game. Why? There's no reason for this.

183590454.review: This version is glitchy as heck, but it is a fantastic game.

183579649.review:
My first ever Final Fantasy game, and man, it was amazing.

The whole game felt like one long and immersive adventure. This strong feel of a true "adventure" makes it incredibly unique and standing out from anything else I've played before.

I loved how, over time, along with the main protagonist, you get deeply invested in the characters and the world. The world-building is phenomenal, each area feels distinct, with its own vibe, creatures, story, and music. This variety adds up so much to this feeling of traveling through a living world. Overall, it felt like a breath of fresh air in its uniqueness compared to typical modern fantasy tropes.

The OST is simply beautiful. Right from the start, when you boot up the game, you are greeted with the iconic piece "To Zanarkand". You just sit there thinking: "Yep, the entire score would be a masterpiece" -  and it absolutely is.

I am not a fan of random encounters, but here, while they were occasionally tedious, they felt okay because the combat system is great. Each character has a ton of abilities, and being able to swap them mid-fight keeps the gameplay engaging. Every enemy has its strengths and weaknesses, which means you are constantly coming up with some kind of strategies. I find the process of figuring out the best approach to each enemy and boss very satisfying.

The leveling system is also great. The massive grid might seem scary, but once you figure it out, it becomes a lot of fun. Each character starts in a different position on the grid, but generally you can build them as you like, similar to Path of Exile. This made leveling up and random encounters feel rewarding.

I was recommended FFX as a starting point for the Final Fantasy series, and I absolutely loved it. So I am passing this recommendation on to others as well!

183553691.review:
FFX算是我FF系列入坑作品之一，我更喜欢的是主角和父亲的故事。
倒是尤娜瓦卡等人我完全看不上，受气包，宗教洗脑蠢货，没脑子的传统男儿，反倒是阿尔贝多族的人三观比较符合正常人的观念。
还有这代的西莫牙真的令我生理心理双重不适的恶心角色，不但坏，还特么带着阶级仇恨。
FFX这个世界的主流民众信这个愚蠢的宗教让人觉得一个个死有余辜。

不过这游戏本身也没必要一定带入阶级史观唯物主义跟它较真。
经典老游戏，推荐

183532799.review: I've never played a final fantasy game besides XIV but this has aged horribly. Nostalgia aside, playing a game like this in 2024 is not a fun experience, fixed camera angles and turn based combat that puts you to sleep is not what I was expecting. It feels like the first resident evil game. I heard it came out on ps2 and got excited being a huge Ratchet and clank fan, but it feels like it was made to be played with an N64 controller. If you like fixed cameras and slow turn based combat maybe this is for you, but I have higher expectations for a ps2 game I guess.
